name: St. Peter of Verona (Peter Martyr)
summary: Peter of Verona was a Dominican friar and inquisitor who was martyred by Cathar heretics. He was one of the first Dominican martyrs and was canonized less than a year after his death, one of the fastest canonizations in Church history. He is remembered for his zealous defense of orthodoxy and his martyrdom, which became a symbol of the Dominican order's commitment to defending the faith.
